name: Corralejo

displayImg.alt: a view of corralejo from a window

description: Corralejo is a charming town located on the northern tip of Fuerteventura, one of Spain's Canary Islands. It is renowned for its stunning beaches, turquoise waters, and vibrant atmosphere. Originally a fishing village, Corralejo has grown into a popular tourist destination, offering a mix of natural beauty, adventure, and local culture. Expect a laid-back vibe with opportunities for watersports, excursions to nearby islands, and sampling delicious Canarian cuisine.

four-things.title: Visit Corralejo Natural Park
four-things.description: Explore this vast expanse of golden sand dunes and crystal-clear waters. It's perfect for a relaxing walk, sunbathing, or kite surfing. The park's unique desert-like landscape is a must-see.

four-things.title: Take a Day Trip to Isla de Lobos
four-things.description: Just a short ferry ride away, Isla de Lobos is a small, uninhabited island offering pristine beaches, hiking trails, and excellent snorkeling opportunities. It's a haven for nature enthusiasts.

image.alt: ferry ride to isla de lobos

four-things.title: Discover the Old Town of Corralejo
four-things.description: Stroll through the narrow streets of the old town to experience its traditional charm. Enjoy local shops, bars, and restaurants offering authentic Canarian dishes.

image.alt: charming restaurant in old town of corralejo

four-things.title: Enjoy Watersports
four-things.description: Corralejo is a hotspot for surfing, windsurfing, and paddleboarding due to its consistent waves and winds. Many schools and rental shops cater to beginners and experts alike.

name: Costa Calma
description: Costa Calma is a tranquil resort town on the southern coast of Fuerteventura, known for its long sandy beaches and serene atmosphere. It is a gateway to the famous Jandía Peninsula and attracts tourists seeking relaxation and watersports. Expect a mix of family-friendly resorts, palm-lined streets, and opportunities for kitesurfing and beach exploration. The town is ideal for those looking for a laid-back holiday experience with access to beautiful nature. Expect stunning beaches with opportunities for sunbathing, swimming, and kiteboarding. Also expect a laid-back vibe suited for relaxation and family vacations as well as access to nature and scenic landscapes, perfect for exploring.

four-things.title: Relax at Playa de Sotavento
four-things.description: One of the most famous beaches in the Canary Islands, Sotavento Beach offers a stunning stretch of golden sand and shallow waters, perfect for swimming or enjoying the breathtaking scenery. It’s also a hotspot for windsurfing and kitesurfing.

image.alt: the famous beach playa de sotavento

four-things.title: Visit Jandía Natural Park
four-things.description: Explore this vast protected area, home to rugged volcanic landscapes, unique flora and fauna, and hiking trails. A visit to the iconic Pico de la Zarza, the island's highest peak, is highly recommended.

four-things.title: Explore Oasis Wildlife Fuerteventura
four-things.description: Located a short drive from Costa Calma, this large animal park features exotic wildlife, botanical gardens, and interactive experiences, making it an excellent outing for families.

four-things.title: Discover Ajuy Caves
four-things.description: Visit the picturesque fishing village of Ajuy and its dramatic volcanic caves. The black sand beach and natural geological formations make for a unique excursion.

name: Caleta de Fuste

displayImg.alt: aerial photo of caleta de fuste

description: Caleta de Fuste, also known as El Castillo, is a family-friendly resort town located on Fuerteventura’s east coast. Renowned for its sheltered bay and golden sandy beaches, it’s a great destination for those seeking a relaxed and convenient holiday. With a marina, a golf course, and a range of restaurants and bars, the town caters to tourists looking for comfort and leisure. Expect calm, shallow waters ideal for swimming and water activities. Also expect a modern resort vibe with plenty of shops, restaurants and amenities, family-friendly activities like mini-golf, boat trips and safe beaches. The location is convenient near the airport and other attractions.

four-things.title: Enjoy Caleta de Fuste Beach
four-things.description: Relax on this crescent-shaped beach with calm waters, perfect for swimming and sunbathing. The nearby promenade offers cafes and restaurants with ocean views.

image.alt: stacked sunbeds on a sandy beach

four-things.title: Visit the Salt Museum (Museo del Sal)
four-things.description: Located just south of the town, this museum showcases the island’s salt production history. You can also visit the nearby salt flats for a unique and picturesque experience.

four-things.title: Take a trip to Oasis Park Fuerteventura
four-things.description: A short drive away, this zoo and botanical garden offers animal encounters, live shows, and lush greenery. Great for families and nature enthusiasts.

four-things.title: Play Golf in Caleta de Fuste
four-things.description: Play a round at one of the area’s well-maintained golf courses, such as the Fuerteventura Golf Club. The courses feature scenic views and facilities for all skill levels.

name: Morro Jable

displayImg.alt: overview of morro jable beach and lighthouse

description: Morro Jable is a charming coastal town located on the southern tip of Fuerteventura. Once a small fishing village, it has grown into a popular tourist destination while retaining much of its traditional charm. Known for its pristine beaches, turquoise waters, and relaxed atmosphere, Morro Jable is ideal for sun-seekers, couples, and families. Expect golden sandy beaches with calm, clear waters. Expect a  mix of modern amenities and traditional charm, including a quaint old town. Water sports and excursions like dolphin and whale watching are popular. Enjoy excellent seafood restaurants and oceanfront dining options.

four-things.title: Relax at Playa del Matorral
four-things.description: This expansive beach is perfect for sunbathing, swimming, and water sports. Its iconic lighthouse, Faro de Morro Jable, is a striking landmark and a great spot for photos.

four-things.title: Explore Morro Jable Old Town
four-things.description: Wander through the narrow streets of the old fishing village, where you can discover local shops, cafes, and traditional Canarian architecture.

image.alt: morro jable old town at night

four-things.title: Traverse Dolphin and Whale Watching Tours
four-things.description: Embark on a boat excursion to spot dolphins, whales, and other marine life in their natural habitat. These tours are popular and depart regularly from Morro Jable’s harbor.

four-things.title: Visit Cofete Beach
four-things.description: A short drive or guided tour from Morro Jable will take you to this remote, breathtaking beach surrounded by mountains. It’s perfect for nature lovers seeking a serene, unspoiled landscape.

image.alt: cofete beach with the mountains behind

name: El Cotillo

displayImg.alt: sign by the sea that names the town

description: El Cotillo is a quaint fishing village on Fuerteventura’s northwest coast, renowned for its relaxed vibe, stunning beaches, and spectacular sunsets. It’s a favorite spot for surfers, nature lovers, and those looking to escape the busier tourist hubs. The village offers a mix of charming local restaurants, historical sites, and unspoiled natural beauty. Expect idyllic beaches with turquoise waters, perfect for swimming or surfing. Expect a peaceful laid-back atmosphere that's ideal for unwinding. Watch incredible sunsets over the atlantic ocean and enjoy delicious seafood served at traditional Canarian restaurants.

four-things.title: Enjoy El Cotillo' Beaches (Playa de la Concha and Lagoons)
four-things.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters and golden sands of Playa de la Concha or explore the lagoons near the village, which are ideal for families and snorkeling.

four-things.title: Visit El Tostón Lighthouse (Faro de El Tostón)
four-things.description: Visit this iconic lighthouse that offers fantastic ocean views and houses a small museum about Fuerteventura’s maritime history.

four-things.title: Enjoy Surfing and Water Sports
four-things.description: The beaches near El Cotillo, such as Playa del Castillo, are known for their excellent waves. Beginners and experienced surfers can find schools and rental options.

four-things.title: Hike the La Caldera Mountain
four-things.description: Hike to the nearby La Caldera volcano for panoramic views of the surrounding coastline and landscapes. It’s a relatively easy hike and a great way to explore the area’s natural beauty.
